column11: name:"Voter Registration and Criminal Records by State
column13: description:"## Voter disfranchisement via a sprawling criminal justice system over time \n\nMany states permanently purge voters from registration rolls if they've ever been found guilty of a felony – even if the crime for which they were convicted is nonviolent and now in some jurisdictions only considered a misdemeanor offense. This dataset breaks down the number of registered voters by state for all elections between 1980 and 2014
column14: and also includes the number of individuals classified as 'felons' who were ineligible to take part in the democratic process even after having served their sentence and re-entered society.\n\n"
column15: alternateName:"Details the number of people who've been denied voting rights over time because of felony crimes."

column156: headline:"Details the number of people who've been denied voting rights over time because of felony crimes."
column177: abstract:"## Voter disfranchisement via a sprawling criminal justice system over time \n\nMany states permanently purge voters from registration rolls if they've ever been found guilty of a felony – even if the crime for which they were convicted is nonviolent and now in some jurisdictions only considered a misdemeanor offense. This dataset breaks down the number of registered voters by state for all elections between 1980 and 2014
column178: and also includes the number of individuals classified as 'felons' who were ineligible to take part in the democratic process even after having served their sentence and re-entered society.\n\n"
